result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Ted A Purvis was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ted A Purvis in court with attorney Ryan W O'Hara.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Ulrich appeared for Lutheran Social Services.
15CF238 and 15CF253 called.  State relates, has no objection to the release plan and requests court adopt it.  Attorney O'Hara relates and requests court adopt the plan.  Court relates, approves the plan and signs the Order (copies of Order given to State, LSS & Attorney O'Hara).  Firearm warning given.
from Lutheran Social Services.
Supervised release hearing at 03-30-2016 11:30 am

Defendant Ted A Purvis in court with attorney Ryan W O'Hara.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF253 & 15CF238. 
State does not contest the NGI. Parties stipulate to conditional release. Parties stipulate to 102 days credit. Victims right have been complied with. VIS filed. 

15CF238 : State moves to amend both counts to 943.20(1)(a) (class A misd.). Court grants amendments. Defendant enters a guilty plea to both counts. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty.

15CF253: State moves to amend count 1 to 946.49(1)(a). Court grants amendment. Defendant enters a guilty plea to both counts. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty.

No corrections are requested to the competency report by parties. Parties stipulate to the findings. Argument by Attorney O'Hara. 

Court finds Mr. Purvis not guilty by reason by mental disease or defect to each of the counts and enters judgment of NGI to each of the counts.  Court orders Mr. Purvis be comitted to the Department of Health and Human Services for 24 months. Commitment will commece today. Court grants 102 days credit. Conditional release plan to be prepared by the Department of Health and Human Services in Rusk County (current county of residence). Plan is to be provided to the court for approval within 21 days. Hearing scheduled. 

Complaint, Amended Information (to be filed by State) and previous reports are to be provided to Department of Health and Human Services by the Clerk's Office.  Supervised release hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Ted A Purvis in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF238 & 15CF253. 
Psychological eval has been received and reviewed. State requests reset for plea discussion. Both cases set for a hearing on 2/4/16 at 9:30 AM - 10:00 AM.  Hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ted A Purvis in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF238 AND 15CF253.

15CF238: Defendant enters dual plea of NG and NGI. Court orders that psychological evaluation completed in 15CF253 from 11/16/15 also apply to 15CF238. 
Both files set for hearing on 12/4/15 at 9:30 for 1 hour.  Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Dr. Heinz.

Witness identifies the Defendant. 11:17: Cross by Defense. 11:22: Redirect by State. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
